metadata.title: CVE-2017-9869 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
The II_step_one function in layer2.c in mpglib, as used in libmpgdecoder.ain LAME 3.99.5 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (buffer over-read and application crash) via a craftedaudio file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lame - 3.99.5+repack1-9build1
libmp3lame0 - 3.99.5+repack1-9build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lame package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.99.5+repack1-9build1').
